name: projectyl
text:
Words broken up in this email: h=elp, n=amely, P=RODUCT
Words not broken up: DRUGS, Viruses, ENHANCED
This spammer has strange ideas of what a spam filter might block.

name: aperson
text:
That's because the equals signs are an artifact of line-breaks translated from one encoding to another one, not a spam-dodging attempt.
{folds arms smugly}

name: thatskotkid
text: You are so ARROGANT!

name: jackparsons
text: Just wait until all your eurotrash characters become weird Japanese characters in the middle of your eurotrash words.

name: geozimmdrake
text: i kinda thought the = was like he went for backspace, and missed.  i do that sometimes.

name: stwee
text: but then the sender would have been trying to advertise a roduct that would amely help with cancer etc

name: stuart
text: This is a real spam message (you can find it posted elsewhere by searching for key phrases), which is why the equals signs at every 76-character line limit (except for "ans=wer", which I'm guessing was altered for stylistic reasons) are appearing unstripped. If you're seeing this happening to you in real life, it's actually more likely a flaw in your e-mail client's handling of quoted-printable than a network node's sendmail mangling. Try another mail program, and if problem persists, contact your system administrator. He'll just fucking love it.

name: invidious
text: Ever have a Yahoo! email account?  This spammer has a pretty good idea of what a spam filter might block.

name: hikikomori
text: Phillipe never ceases to amaze.  He can recreate Mr. Bear's speech and probable reaction flawlessly in his mind.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: hikikomori, to hear you i would believe you never were a child.

name: heavymetaljesus
text: Poor Phillipe, at least he didn't cry this time.

name: lunchbox
text: Did you notice that the characters play sort of different familial roles to Phillipe? Cornelius portrays the stern, informative father, Roast Beef plays the worrying and supportive mother, Lyle plays the abusive older brother, etc.

name: achilleselbow
text: I always saw Teodor as the mother and Roast Beef as the nice older brother, but otherwise you hit it right on the head. Ray would be the eccentric rich uncle of course.

name: i_love_kate
text: Teodor actually describes himself (somewhat sardonically) as "big brother" in one of the blogs, referring to his relationship with Philippe.

name: satyr
text: Silly T, of course you may make a food/cunnilingus analogy. In fact, I insist.

name: banzairabbit
text:
Phillipe is a lot like my father with a computer.

"Dad, whatever you do, do not click on the huge red flashing icon that says WARNING: DELETE ENTIRE WORLD -- DO NOT CLICK EVER."

"What, you mean this?" *click* "AAAAUGH!"

name: heccibiggs
text:
Ah, my dad is equally, frustratingly shit with computers. I'll often insist on doing his task for him because it makes it so much quicker, and he has this really weird thing where you're on a page and he'll go, "Okay, go up." "What do you mean?" "Go up!" "Dad, I'm at the very top of the page, there is no up to go." "Yes there is, you did it a second ago, make the page go up..!"

After a while, I realised that he wanted me to scroll down, which makes the page look like it's moving upwards (if you think like an idiot, I guess).

name: banzairabbit
text:
It kind of makes sense.

My dad also still says "punch it in", as in "It's asking for my name here, should I punch it in?" At first I thought he was going to get all violent on my PC.

name: i_love_kate
text: Whenever iTunes takes three minutes to load I'm tempted to punch my computer in.

name: tekende
text: You experience times when iTunes doesn't take three minutes to load?

name: banzairabbit
text:
For what it's worth, you have as of now viewed exatly 1337 strips.

I bow to your leet.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Oh, I'm so happy you caught that! It's gone up now. Dang new strips.

But yeah, that was superfly. I did manage to view it briefly. Ahh..
